name: Tungsten carbide
desc: Tungsten carbide (chemical formula: WC) is a chemical compound (specifically, a carbide) containing equal parts of tungsten and carbon atoms. In its most basic form, tungsten carbide is a fine gray powder, but it can be pressed and formed into shapes for use in industrial machinery, cutting tools, abrasives, armor-piercing rounds, other tools and instruments, and jewelry.

images.alt: α-Tungsten carbide in the unit cell

Other cations:
Molybdenum carbide
Titanium carbide
Silicon carbide
